SimpleTimer.node: A timer for recording the running time of the workflow. Can be used to measure performance and execution time.

inputs.anything: Passthrough input. Any data type is accepted and will be passed to the output.
inputs.timer_name: The name of the timer. Used as an identifier for the global timer.
inputs.mode: The timer mode: 'start/reset' creates or resets the timer, 'total time record' shows time since start, 'since last record' shows time since last recording.
inputs.display_format: The format for displaying time: 'number in seconds', 'number in nanoseconds', '%H:%M:%S.%f', or 'text description'.

outputs.time: The formatted time string based on the selected display format.

SimpleCurrentDatetime.node: Retrieve the current date and time when this node is executed.

inputs.anything: Passthrough input. Any data type is accepted and will be passed to the output.
inputs.time_format: The format for displaying the current time. Choose from a comprehensive list of common datetime formats.
inputs.use_custom_format: If enabled, use the custom format string instead of the selected time format.
inputs.custom_format: A custom datetime format string using Python strftime directives.

outputs.datetime_string: The current datetime as a formatted string.

SimpleStringAppending.node: Append a string to another string at the beginning or end.

inputs.string: The original string to append to.
inputs.append_position: Where to append: 'at the beginning' (True) or 'at the end' (False).
inputs.text_to_append: The text to append to the original string.

SimpleStringWrapping.node: Wrap a string with a prefix and suffix.

inputs.prefix: The text to prepend to the beginning of the string.
inputs.suffix: The text to append to the end of the string.

SimpleStringSevering.node: Sever a string into two parts using a delimiter.

inputs.delimiter: The delimiter to use for severing the string.
inputs.index_selector: Which delimiter occurrence to use: 'first', 'last', or 'decided by index'.
inputs.delimiter_index: The index of the delimiter to use (0-based). Only used when index_selector is 'decided by index'.

outputs.first_part: The first part of the severed string (before the selected delimiter).
outputs.second_part: The second part of the severed string (after the selected delimiter).

SimpleSwitchWithRandomMode.node: Select one input from multiple inputs. Supports random selection mode.

inputs.selected_index: The index of the input to select (1-based). Ignored if random mode is enabled.
inputs.select_random: If Yes, select an input randomly from connected inputs instead of using the selected index.

SimpleInversedSwitchWithRandomMode.node: Distribute one input to one of multiple outputs. Supports random selection mode.

inputs.selected_index: The index of the output to send the value to (1-based). Ignored if random mode is enabled.
inputs.select_random: If Yes, select an output randomly instead of using the selected index.

outputs.output_N: N-th output slot. Only the selected slot receives the input value; others are None.

SimplePrintToConsole.node: Print a message to the console with optional rich formatting and timestamp.

inputs.anything: Passthrough input. Any data type is accepted and will be passed to the output.
inputs.is_rich_format: If Yes, interpret the message as rich markup (requires rich library).
inputs.with_timestamp: If Yes, prepend a logging-style timestamp to the message.
inputs.message: The message to print to the console.

SimplePythonScript.node: Execute a Python script in an isolated environment. The input is available as 'INPUT' variable.

inputs.anything: Passthrough input. Available in the script as the 'INPUT' variable.
inputs.script: The Python script to execute. Define a 'RESULT' variable to pass data to the output.

outputs.RESULT: The value of the 'RESULT' variable defined in the script, or None if not defined.
